entry.title: the Wilbraham (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although the Wilbraham (pictured) was built as a bachelor apartment, more women than men lived there by 1929?

entry.title: Debra Lew Harder (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Debra Lew Harder is the fifth person to host the Metropolitan Opera radio broadcasts since they began in 1931?

entry.title: University of the West Indies Seismic Research Centre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the University of the West Indies Seismic Research Centre, which is 70 years old this year, once had an earthquake processing system called "WurstMachine"?

entry.title: hiding power (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that hiding power can be measured?

entry.title: Mavis Paterson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mavis Paterson, an octogenarian grandmother, has cycled more than 10,000 miles (16,000 km) for charity?

entry.title: red teams (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that red teams are used to test airport security?

entry.title: Dee Winters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that football player Dee Winters, who helped bring TCU to a national championship appearance and was selected in the 2023 NFL Draft, grew up in a small town with only one gas station?

entry.title: A [For 100 Cars] (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in A [For 100 Cars], an orchestra of cars play the note A for 28 minutes?
